Quotes: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Virtue cannot separate itself from reality without becoming a principle of evil.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: You ask me if I keep a notebook to record my great ideas. I've only ever had one.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: We are so very 'umble.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: I add this, that rational ability without education has oftener raised man to glory and virtue, than education without natural ability.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Virtuous people often revenge themselves for the constraints to which they submit by the boredom which they inspire.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: If you can, help others;if you cannot do that, at least do not harm them.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quotes: Virtue is like a rich stone, best plain set.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: Perfect valour consists in doing without witnesses that which we would be capable of doing before everyone.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Good advice is something a man gives when he is too old to set a bad example.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Men give away nothing so liberally as their advice.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Perfect behavior is born of complete indifference.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: You cannot be a hero without being a coward.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: In heaven an angel is nobody in particular.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Silence is the most perfect expression of scorn.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Choose silence of all virtues, for by it you hear other men's imperfections, and conceal your own.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: The only failure one should fear, is not hugging to the purpose they see as best.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: If I have done the public any service, it is due to my patient thought.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quotes: I do not seek. I find.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: Not to help justice in her need would be an impiety.
Author: Plato

Quotes: All the gold which is under or upon the earth is not enough to give in exchange for virtue.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Tyrants have always some slight shade of virtue;they support the laws before destroying them.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: What most persons consider as virtue, after the age of 40 is simply a loss of energy.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: O! Let me not be mad, not mad, sweet heaven;keep me in temper;I would not be mad!
Author: William Shakespeare
